service.name: Child Dental Benefits Schedule
service.description:
The Child Dental Benefits Schedule (CDBS) provides financial support for basic dental services for children aged 2-17.  It provides eligible children with a capped benefit of $1000 (indexed annually) over two calendar years for basic dental services. The eligibility of a child is determined by meeting an age requirement, a means test, and they must also be eligible for Medicare services.
The CDBS replaces the Medicare Teen Dental Plan from 1 January 2014.
